results.title: Everthing you wanted to know about sex but were afraid to ask.
results.creator_credit: Woody Allen, Charles H. Joffe, Brodsky-Gould Productions and Jack Rollins & Charles H. Joffe Productions
results.brief_description: Loosely based upon the book by David R. Reuben, this Woody Allen classic answers some of the timeless (and tasteless) questions about society’s oldest taboo: sex. It consists of a series of vignettes, one of which has Gene Wilder experiencing a woolly love affair with a sheep, and another has Tony Randall and Burt Reynolds showing an unorthodox view of sex - from the inside out. Woody Allen once said about sex: “It’s the most fun I’ve ever had without laughing.” Allen’s confronting style may not sit well with all viewers - you may find yourself squirming uncomfortably in your seat at some of the scenes - and it may not be everything you always wanted to know about sex, but as a comedy it’s everything you’ve always known about Woody Allen.
results.title_for_label: Everthing you wanted to know about sex but were afraid to ask.

results.title: Evergreen
results.brief_description: Jessie Matthews, “the dancing divinity” of British cinema in the 1930’s, stars in this attempt to emulate the large production musicals of MGM. The score is by Rodgers and Hart, and each number “adds a little something to the story.” A young actress successfully impersonates her own mother, a former music-hall star who had mysteriously disappeared a quarter of a century earlier at the height of her career. This promotional gimmick of the “star who will never grow old” sets in motion an intriguing story of mistaken identity and sexual ambiguity.

results.title: Even cowgirls get the blues
results.creator_credit: Gus Van Sant, Laurie Parker, Fourth Features and New Line Cinema
results.brief_description: Even cowgirls get the blues is a comedy directed by Gus Van Sant (My own private Idaho, Psycho, Good Will Hunting, To die for), who also wrote the screenplay, from the Tom Robbins book of the same name. Uma Thurman stars as Sissy Hankshaw, a woman born with enormous thumbs, which leads her to believe that her destiny is to hitchhike around America, looking for some meaning in her life. Sissy is essentially a social outcast in search of a family who will accept her and her oversized thumbs. After spending time in New York as a model, Sissy finds herself at the Rubber Rose Ranch on an assignment, where she meets and falls in love with Bonanza Jellybean (Rain Phoenix). Jellybean is planning to take over the ranch from The Countess (John Hurt) and Miss Adrian (Angie Dickinson). The film is riddled with other subplots involving peyote, whooping cranes and a mountain-man prophet, The Chink (Pat Morita), with whom Sissy forms a relationship. Cast also includes Roseanne Arnold, Buck Henry, Sean Young, Crispin Glover, Keanu Reeves, Heather Graham and a cameo by William Burroughs. Author Tom Robbins provides a voice-over narration, reading prose from his book, “Even cowgirls get the blues”. Soundtrack by K.D. Lang.

results.title: Even cowboys
results.creator_credit: Noellie Taylor, Tanya Uren, Joanne Hamilton, Sue Byrne and Swinburne Institute of Technology. Film and Television School
results.brief_description: A look at a travelling wild west routine that goes from the prosaic to the ridiculous. From Bendigo to Wangaratta and the potholes incurred when rivals come up against stiff opposition.

results.title: Eve Lambart
results.creator_credit: Margaret Wescott, Edward Le Lorrain and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: Film animator Eve Lambart spent over thirty years working at the National Film Board, and now she has retired. This retirement means many things to her: gardening, sewing, baking and preserving, weaving, and even filmmaking in her own animation studio during her “spare” time. Always an individualist, she is enjoying her self-contained new lifestyle to the fullest.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Margaret Wescott, Edward Le Lorrain and National Film Board of Canada

results.title: Eve Arnold in retrospect
results.creator_credit: Beeban Kidron, Spencer Style, BBC and Wonderland
results.brief_description: Eve Arnold, member of the celebrated Magnum photographic agency since 1957 is the subject of this informative documentary which looks not only at her work, but the influence her life experiences have had on her art. Her extensive portfolio of work includes many well known figures and has captured some of the centuries memorable moments. Subjects include; Margaret Thatcher, Malcolm X, Marilyn Monroe, Marlene Dietrich, Joan Crawford, plus many more celebrities, places and faces.

results.title: Evariste Galois
results.brief_description:
Evariste Galois made significant contributions to several branches of mathematics, particularly in the domain of equations. Astruc follows what is to be Galois’s last night before he is killed in a duel. Narrated by Jean Negroni.

Credits: Producer, Jean Salvy ; director, writer, Alexandre Astruc ; photography, Jacques Mercanton ; music, Antoine Duhamel.
Cast: Jose Varela, Vincent Kaldor, Francois Perrot, Gerard Dauzat, Jean Sobieski.

results.title: Ukraine wins Eurovision
results.brief_description: Watch the moment that the 2022 Eurovision Song Contest winner was announced. A profound moment for Ukraine amidst the current political climate across the war-torn nation, as reflected by Kalush Orchestra band mate’s acceptance speech states; “This victory is for every Ukrainian!” The six-member band received special permission to leave the country to represent Ukraine.
results.description:
This video features in a responsive display in the museum that presents the moments, stories and memes capturing the zeitgeist by going viral on the internet.

“This victory is for every Ukranian!” Kalush Orchestra declared when they won the 2022 Eurovision Song Contest with ‘Stefania’. The folk-rap group received special permission to travel to the competition in Turin, Italy from war-torn Ukraine. Ukranian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy congratulated the band via the Telegram messaging app. Since Russia invaded Ukraine 13 weeks ago, Zelenskyy has harnessed the power of social media to spread a message of defiance, appearing in low-fi broadcasts from his phone, often in military fatigues, to condemn the invasion and rally international support. His recorded messages have also been incorporated into other competitions and award shows, including the Grammys and Oscars.
description_for_label: “This victory is for every Ukranian!” Kalush Orchestra declared when they won the 2022 Eurovision Song Contest with ‘Stefania’. results.title: European Art School: 4
results.creator_credit: Anders Holmertz and European Art School
results.brief_description: The final of the ‘European Art School’ series, this program discusses guidelines for composition in a range of artistic work including painting and drawing. It outlines how shapes can be geometrical, natural or abstract and the varying effects, some positive, others negative, that this can have on composition. The program also covers how other elements in art, such as balance, colour and movement, can be used to create contrasting or unifying values in the composition of an art work.

results.title: European Art School: 3
results.creator_credit: Anders Holmertz and European Art School
results.brief_description: In this third program, Mario Massanyi and his colleagues explain and explore the principles involved in the use of colour in drawing and painting. They discuss methods of creating your own colour combinations to create varying tints and shades and the evocative qualities of colour to create mood and texture. In painting particularly, they demonstrate the effective methods of creating such mood and texture through the application of paint in a variety of different ways.
